sen.j: 隼人司（はやとし）は、律令制において衛門府、後に兵部省に属した機関。
sen.e: Hayatoshi was the institution belonged to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and later Hyobusho (ministry of military) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

Hayatoshi (Hayato Office) was the institution that belonged to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and later Hyobusho (ministry of military) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: Hayatoshiの補足追加 (参照: http://www.unterstein.net/or/docs/JapanRanks.pdf)、belonged→that belongedに修正
sen.e: Hayatoshi (Hayato Office) was the institution that belonged to Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and later Hyobusho (ministry of military) on the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 訓ははやひとのつかさなど。
sen.e: Kun (Japanese reading) was Hayahito no Tsukasa.
Kun (Japanese reading) was Hayahito no Tsukasa.
Kun (Japanese reading) was Hayahito no Tsukasa.

sen.j: 隼人司は、朝貢・移住する隼人の管理や彼らへの歌舞の教習、または隼人の竹笠といった竹製品製作などをつかさどった。
sen.e: Hayatoshi governed management of Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) who brought tributes and was immigrated, instruction of utamai (a performance of singing and dancing) to them, or manufacturing of bamboo products such as Hayato's bamboo hats.

Hayatoshi governed management of Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) who brought tributes and was immigrated, instruction of utamai (a performance of singing and dancing) to them, or manufacturing of bamboo products such as Hayato's bamboo hats.

Hayatoshi governed management of Hayato (an ancient tribe in Kyushu) who brought tributes and was immigrated, instruction of utamai (a performance of singing and dancing) to them, or manufacturing of bamboo products such as Hayato's bamboo hats.

sen.j: 当初は九州の隼人についての業務もおこなっていたが、後に畿内やその近辺の隼人のみに限るようになる。
sen.e: Hayatoshi initially worked on Hayato in Kyushu, but later worked only on Hayato in and around Kinai Province.
Hayatoshi initially worked on Hayato in Kyushu, but later worked only on Hayato in and around the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: Kinai Province→the Kinai regionとしました。
sen.e: Hayatoshi initially worked on Hayato in Kyushu, but later worked only on Hayato in and around the Kinai region.

sen.j: 移住した隼人は、大嘗祭などの儀式・行事への参加も行っていた。
sen.e: Immigrated Hayato attended the rituals and events such as Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor).
Immigrated Hayato attended the rituals and events such as Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor).
Immigrated Hayato attended the rituals and events such as Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the succession of an emperor).

sen.j: 大同 (日本)3年（808年）にいったん廃止されてから、兵部省の管轄の下に入る。
sen.e: After it was abolished once in 808, and it came under the jurisdiction of Hyobusho.
After it was abolished once in 808, and it came under the jurisdiction of Hyobusho.
After it was abolished once in 808, and it came under the jurisdiction of Hyobusho.

sen.j: この事はもともと、隼人が朝廷の軍事に従事していた伝統によるものと考えられている。
sen.e: This was originally by the tradition that Hayato served for the military of the imperial court.
This was originally by the tradition that Hayato served for the military of the Imperial Court.
This was originally by the tradition that Hayato served for the military of the Imperial Court.
Sho (Shorokuinoge (Senior Sixth Rank), Lower Grade)), one individual.
Kami (Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual.
Kami (Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual.
Jo (Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank), Shohachii (Senior Eighth Rank))), one individual.
Jo (Shohachiinojo [Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]), one individual.
sen.cmt: 「従六位正八位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正八位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Jo (Shohachiinojo [Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]), one individual.

sen.j: 令史（大初位下） 一名
sen.e: Reishi (Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank), Daishoi (Great Initial Rank)), one individual.
Reishi (Daihatsuinoge [Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual.
sen.cmt: 「従六位大初位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「大初位下」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Reishi (Daihatsuinoge [Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade]), one individual.
Shibu (low rank bureaucrats), 10 individuals.
